text: Lakrids som i en Limfjordsporter men mere let i fylder. Let smag af blomme også. Porter når det skal være en nydeøl.
Schwarz mit reichlich hellbraunem Schaum. Röstmalzig, Kaffee. Kakao, dunkle Schokolade, etwas Zitrus, leicht bitter.
Drank with Lennart at his place 17-5-17. Very good beer. Nice body, and good, full coffee taste. Excellent.

Bottle.Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma is strong of coffee and chocolate,nice roasted and malty with good full body and slight oily mouthfeels,good nots of hops and wood and creamy smooth finish.

Aroma is ice coffee with some bitterness. The taste is massive ice coffee, slight bitterness balanced with some sweet chocolate and roasted grains. Very well balanced. Average carbo. Very nice palate which fills the whole mouth with soft bitter coffee. The aftertaste lasts and is complex. This is the way I like the coffee-beer combo.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Black colour with light brown foam. Aroma of black coffee, chocolate and a bit of sourness. Nice taste of dark roasted coffee, licorice and dark malt.
Bottle at home. Pours dark with good amount of beige head. Fruit, hops, chocolate, coffee with milk. Good bitterness, juicy fruit, medium carbonation. Goes down easily. Very smooth and oily.

Very good aroma, cannot tell what it is. Beige head, brown liquid. First taste is roasted malts and hops. Medium taste is some bitterness from hopsand some slight spicy notes. Light sweet, medium bitter. Aftertaste is white Belgian chocolate and coffee. Very good balance between sweetness and roast and bitterness. Overall very good beer. Alcohol very well hidden.

Dark brown/black, medium thick beige head, sticky lacing. Very good aroma of coffee and chocolate, with some mild, fruity hops. Very smooth to sip, full bodied and soft carbonation, almost creamy. Taste of Belgian chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and some hops to balance, with some mild citrus notes and a solid bitterness, cant taste the booze. Excellent black IPA, best I had in a good while.

Good taste of coffee, caramel, soy and dark chocolate. The aroma is coffee and chocolate. Good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Good beer but had a little higher expectations of it. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Big and abrasive - pine char and roast. Moderately bitter, big bodied and a little sweet with citrus underneath. Not too shabby.
Almost black with thin head. Aroma and flavour are quite strong with resinous hop in the first instance. Later the bitterness of roasted malts and coffee come though.

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2016-12-26 Göteborg 
AR: coffey, roasted malt, pine, citrus zest, 
AP: dark brown, high frothy dark brown steady fluff
F: roasted malt, heavy roasted coffey, tropical fruity, citrus zest, pine, bitter +

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2017 À: tropical fruit, roasted coffee.
A: black brown body 1 finger head
T: fruity and roasted at the same time. Nice
P: medium body medium carbonation. Creamy 

O: very well done, nice balance of roasted and hoppiness.

Bière en bouteille de 33 cl via Saveur bière. Brune foncé à quelques reflets et mousse beige abondante. Superbe nez houblonné, herbeux, épicé et café. Bouche extraordinaire déquilibre entre les saveurs chocolat, café, florales, lamertume (élevée) et lalcool. Cuisses magnifiques pour cette jolie noire danoise. Top !

33cl bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 30-03-2015.
BBD: 28-04-2016.
In short: bitter black ale.
Pours black with nice tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Coffee, roasty, smoky, caramel nose. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is quite bitter, roasty, coffee, ends quite dry.

Fest in schwarzer Hand. Der cremige Verführer treibt die Bohnen und Hopfen Collaboration zur Perfektion. Mehr säuerliche Rotfruchtattacken im Röstmantel wären unerträglich. Lederkracher. Halleluja. Fassholzoflavours inklusive. 0,33l Flasche für schlappe 48DKK. Aus den MIKKELLER BOTTLE SHOP Kopenhagen.
Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Drukket hjemme 4 Nov 16. Svart. Høyt mokkafarget stabilt skum. Lett sjokoladearoma. Smaken tørr kaffe med hint av sjokolade. Koseøl.

Mooi zwart bier met dikke mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Heerlijk aroma en smaken van koffie, honing, hop, fruitig, een zoetje, met een lekkere droge, hoppige, bittere afdronk die goed blijft hangen. Doet mij in de verte even denken aan de "Black Hole". Zegt alleen maar hoe goed dit bier is. 9,2 % abv zeer goed verborgen. Excellent in balans. Super !!

Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with JFK10000 and Josip. Pours dark brown with large lasting creamy light brown head. Heavy malty roasted, lots of burnt coffee, moderate hoppiness, citrus, fruity. Long and harsh bitter finish. Creamy. Medium bodied.

Negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beis. Aromas de café, bizcocho, pomelo, pinos, resina y fondo de malta. Cuerpo denso con sabor y textura maltosa, bizcocho, seguido de pomelo que acaba en un amargor tostado y resinoso largo.
backlog. Dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma has roast, dark roast, slight chocolate. Loads of dry coffee notes. Dry and bitter. Nice enough

Bottle @ Fox and Hounds, Sønderborg. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy beige head. Clear aroma of hops and roast, with notes of coffee and touches of yeast. Bitter, roasty and hoppy flavour, with notes of coffee, citrus and malt and touches of fruit and yeast. Biter and estery aftertaste with coffee like hints. The taste does not reveal the high ABV. Well-balanced and enjoyable. A very decent Black IPA!

Robe noire, mousse crémeuse chocolat au lait, haute, dense et de belle tenue, laissant une belle dentelle sur le verre. Nez sur les arômes grillés : café et pain toasté. Bouche crémeuse et légèrement sucrée, arômes de café, les houblons herbeux sont également très présents, forte amertume. lalcool est bien masqué, la lonueur interminable. Excellente bière, entre le stout et la black ipa.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Аромат кофе чувству& хорошо, но вкус простов& плотнос& не хватает

330ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Langnes.Crocheted lacing from a frothy, lasting, bubbly, fawn-coloured head. Near black with a shade of brown. Burst of inviting aromas of cocoa, dark chocolate and dark fruits. Well blended taste of dark chocolate, coffee, and pine needles. Lingering dark malty bitterness to the finish added by a subdued backdrop of chili. Full bodied. Just lovely and my best so far this year (Friday eve sipper at home, Tromsø 14.10.2016).
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Botella 33cl cervezasdiferentes.es, Cerveza negra de gran sabor, se nota mucho el toque de café, gran cerveza de Mikkeller

On tap at Crunchys. Pours black with white lacing. Great coffee taste and aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Вроде казалос& что будет интерес& BDIPA, но на нос пустова& и на вкус, жжёнка перекры& хмельну& горечь.
How: bottle Appearance: dark brwon with a tiny light brown head. Aroma: coffee, cocoa, pine, red berries, wood, minerals, hint of lemon. Palate: medium body, average to soft carbonaiton.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Colour is black with large brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Some fruits, hops, coffee and roasted malts.

Bottle at home picked up from BEER:Shop St Albans. Many thanks to Srah for this one. A lively black, chestnut brown coloured pour with a bif frothy mid tan head. Aroa is rich black roast, roast, dark choc, rubber, toasted pine. Palate is medium bodied, creamy, smooth, moderate carbonation. Flavour is composed of rich bitter dark choc, woody roasted coffee, burnt pine. Little citrus edge to it as well. Xolid black ipa.
Bottle. Pitch black pour with brown head. Aroma has flowers on top of a light base. Taste is very balanced and fresh. Ends with some caramel and light malt. Medium carbonation. Heavy body

Bottle 33cl
@ Cervezas Diferentes, Coslada, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, coffee, licorice, hops.

0.33 bottle.   An impenetrable, black color with a huge, creamy, latte head. Aroma of dark malts, bread, vanilla, some candy sweetness, and only delicate coffee. Taste is malty, sweet, a tad fruity, definitely marked by hops. A medium to full body, an oily texture, and a flat carbonation. Finish is longish, a bit more malty. Overall the beer is surprisingly good and despite its name does not rely on coffee to pull it through.

330ml bottle pours black in color with a finger and a half of light brown head tht leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus and coffee with some light roasted grains and chocolate. Taste is a light roasted grain, coffee and grapefruit bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Strong enough to be a DIPA, but black DIPA doesnt exist yet. Anyways, a well crafted brew that is nicely balanced and flavourful. Highly recommended.
0,33l bottle from Firmabier. Pours black colour with thick long lasting head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, fruitiness, liquorice, chocolate, hoppiness. Mediumish body, quite bitter.

330 ml flaske delt på RBHD-samling på Fjøløy. Tåkete mørk mahognifarget kropp med lavt lysebrunt skumdekke. Lukter tyrkisk kaffe, søt og jordaktig. Nydelig smak av søt konsentrert kaffe. Myk å drikke. Lang og god ettersmak med en litt pepperaktig og alkovarm kaffesmak.

Pours black as Coke with a huge frothy beige head. Aroma of piney hops and coffee. Taste is complex dark malty, maybe with an addition of chilli somewhere, lots of piney hops and bitter liquorice, very good
Shared bottle at local tasting, ØL øy, saturday 3.session..
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Fjøløy 03.09.16. Mahogany. Creamy and persistent beige head. Fine aroma and taste of freshly roasted coffe, dark chocolate and a hint of chili. Very good!
Almost black color, brownish foam. Aroma: coffee, caramel and prunes, a little port wine. Taste: coffee, burnt malt, caramel, slightly vanilla, prunes, wine, very warming, good hop bitterness.

Deep red-brown, light brown head. Roasted malt and coffee, brown sugar, vanilla, dried fruit, licorice, hints of citrus and alcohol. Roasted malt taste, espresso, licorice, fruity notes, hint of resin, bitter finish. Full body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol.

Drank w Matt after Leslies funeral. Opaque warm dark brown with beige fizzy head. Smells of nutty brown ale malt, coffee, moderate minerality and herbal hoppiness, light to moderate booze, slightly oaty, light nutmeg/spice and plum and stone fruit, hint of clove and funky farmhouse yeast. Coffee is warm, not too bitter or acidic, very slightly honey/sweet. A complex and ultra fine nose. Taste has more acidic coffee than the aroma; subtle dark fruit. Body is incredibly silky smooth, medium to long lasting, slightly chocolate chewy and chalky finish. An excellent black IPA - less dark than most others Ive tried, incredibly smooth and very complex esp. in the nose and palate. Would get again.

Bottle from Craftissimo at home. Black pour with big puffy head that spills down on itself. Aroma is bright roasted coffee with tart hoppiness - very smooth overall (like a more roasted Stone Mocha IPA). Taste is rich bitter coffee with a sharp hoppy bite, smooth roasted maltiness, and a lasting boozy warmth. Really nice bright coffee black IPA. Deliciously smooth rich palate.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a dark brown to black with a small tan head and an aroma of black coffee, molasses, roasted malts, cocoa, vanilla and citrus. The taste is slightly sweet with lots of coffee bitterness and a long lasting bitter finish. Very good beer!

Pitch black body, brown head. Espresso and big raw coffee aroma, little bit chocolate and liquorice with some cactus and chilli pepper notes. Nice choco taste, cocoa and coffee, some syrup, sweet finish. Average carbonation and full body. Love it. //bottle at Craft Room

Bottle. Black pour, creamy head. Aroma of roasted malt, fruity malt, coffee and orange. Smooth taste has orange zest, coffee, bitter fruity hop, toffee, roasted malt and a bittersweet finish. Very nice.

Tap. Pours opaque mahogany, small rapidly diminishing beige head, some lacing. Aroma is really coffee prominent, cocoa, hint of green pepper. Flavor is light sweet, medium bitter, roasty, mocha, coffee flavors, savory. Medium body, lingering bitterness. A coffee black IPA. Why the hell did this take so long?

Black, medium creamy tan head, good lacing. Aroma is of hoppy fruity notes, watermelon, citrus and loads of coffee and coffee beans. Taste is medium sweet malt, dark chocolate, strong coffee, some roasted acidity, medium watermelon fruity and citrus hoppy, medium+ bitterness, dry coffee finish and long lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, average carbonation, oily. Hoppier aroma, while coffee stronger in taste. Very good.
(bottle)
Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Black. Finger thick, tan head. Sweet. Bitter ending. Red fruit, dates, chocolate, coffee flavour. Thick body, medium amount of carbonation.

Bottle. Pours black with a tall, tan head. Aroma of flowers, chocolate and coffee, very complex and layered aroma, it is also hoppy, perhaps orange and grapefruit. Full bodied, soft. Long bittersweet finish. Amazing flavour, complex, yet balanced. Coffee, chocolate and grapefruit. Fabulous beer.

Pours black with tall light tan head. Aroma of coffee, citrus, mellow dark chocolate, light grapefruit. Taste is sweet chocolate at first followed by a coffee and citrus bitter finish. Very nicely balanced. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

Smell of hops, spruce. Dark brown colour, high brown head. Aroma of coffee, hops, licorice. Finishes with oat. Tastes like a twisted link between IPA and stout. Soft palate, soft texture, feels almost padded. Flat carbon.

Do tap. Cerveja escura, marrom, com creme de baixa formação. Aroma de malte torrado e café, com um toque herbal e cítrico. O sabor acompanha o aroma, com bom equilíbrio entre o malte e o lúpulo. O final é herbal, seco, um pouco amargo. Ótima cerveja.

33cl flesje via Drankgigant
Alcoholpercentage van 9,2%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met mooie crèmelaagje van schuim 

Aroma en smaak: neus is lekker Amerikaans hoppig, smaak is koffie, chocolade, donker fruit, gebrande mouten, flink bitter

Conclusie: erg lekker, hoppig en stout in 1



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of some roasted malt and coffee, citrus hops. Dark brown colour with tan head, not lasting. Taste is moderate+ bitter and dry, more coffee and its bitterness. Medium body, oily feel, bitter finish.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, july 25th 2015. Black body with a small tanned head. Aroma of roasted malt, citrus, distinct chocolate. Tasrte is fullbodied coffee with mild fruity hop notes. Low sweetness, dry and bitter. Ash and tar in finish, pleasant lasting pine notes. Quite good.

A bottle in Fox and Hounds in Sønderborg Denmark. Color is very dark brown with nice beige head. Aroma is roasty coffee and some hops. Taste is well balanced and its not as strong as you would expect from the color, but in a good way. Taste is sweet with roasty coffee notes and short bitter finish. Very nice dipa.

Absolutnie super kawowe piwo. Podwojne espresso. Pianka spora niczym crema na wloskim espresso. Ciemne czarne i nieprzepuszczajace swiatla. Piana spora i trwala znaczaca slady na szkle. Aromat kawy ziarnistej, swiezo zmielonej. W smaku kawowa moc, palonosc i lekka slodycz w tle niczym tiramisu z kawa 100% arabica.

Notas a lupulo herbal, maltas tostadas y café. Color obscuro, cuerpo medio, corona de espuma abundante de buena retención.
En boca es amargo, herbal, sin embargo el café no se percibe del todo pero logra cortar los sabores amargos y lupulados que se esperan en una black ipa.
Buena cerveza pero a mi gusto le falta algo de integración en los sabores
From tap at Mikkeller Bar. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, caramel, coffee and bitterness.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Murky brownish pour with a tan head. Notes of bitter coffee, some dark dried fuits, light hops, more coffee and some heavy roast.

Tap @ mikkeller Aarhus. Pours murky dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has lots and lots of bright roasted coffee, toasted malts, grassy hops, cocoa and some toffee. Nice aroma. The taste is citrussy and piney up front with some acidic cold coffee behind that. Also some toasted malts and with a bitter hoppy aftertaste. A nice coffee forward black IPA.
Black with thick beige head. Roasted, hoppy aroma. Some coffee and licorice. Flavour has piney, grassy bitterness, coffee and licorice. Creamy, slightly chewy with long bitter finish. Solid DIPA.

Dark brown to black beer, medium tan head. Nose is coffee, milk chocolate, lots of citric hops. Flavor is soft, roasty, chocolate, coffee. Finish is pretty hoppy, lots of citrus, mainly grapefruit, bitterness. Hides the considerable booze amount pretty well. Works for me.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 10/06/17. brunatno-brazowe, chyba lekko metne, z super piana. aromaty... i tu zdziwko - ciemne owoce, rodzynki, to jest to co dominuje na dziendobry. z zamknietymi oczami pomyslalbym o ciemnym belgu, dublu czy czyms takim... choc moze nie, bo pod spodem czuc zywice, ktore nabieraja sily wraz z ogrzewaniem sie piwa. kawy brak. za to w ustach juz kawa sie pojawia., zywiczno-cytrusowe chmiele na drugim miejscu, zas ciemne owoce w tle. goryczka srednia, dosc mila. kwaskowate posmaki, mimo, ze w ustach raczej w nieco slodkawa niz wytrawna strone. srednie wysycenie, ciut syropowo, srednio ciala. bardzo fajnie poukladane to wszystko, bardzo mi smakuje. i jest fajnie specyficzne, wymyka sie klasyfikacjom stylistycznym.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours black with good tan head. Aroma is dark malts and pine. Taste is thick verging on unctious, lots of layered dark malts, chocolate and light pine teasers. Just enough coffee hints to keep things interesting and complex. Coffee beers arent generally for me, but this is alright in my eyes.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are coffee, pine, and some citrus.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with huge creamy light brown head. Aroma is intense and complex with roasted malt, green sour plums, gun powder, wet cardboard, oysters, fish marked, horse blanket, freshly ground coffee beans, gravy, soy sauce and salty licorice. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light acidic and medium umami. Body is oily with light fizzy carbonation. Finish use long and bitter with notes of milk, spruce, soy sauce, licorice, coffee, prunes, apples, Thai fish sauce and hints of dry gin. Good complexity if not served too cold.
Pours from the bottle with a thick foamy head. Coffee and hop notes on the aroma, the coffee bitterness cuts through the sweetness of the beer, but also hides some of the hop influence.
Zeer donkere kleur met romige schuimkraag. Bier smaakt best wel goed, lekkere bittere koffiesmaak.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: coffee domination, roasted malt and grassy hoppy balance. Coffee and roasted coffee expresso domination. Taste: full body with roasted malt, coffee and expresso coffee notes. Good grassy balance with chocolate and black chocolate finish. You wont feel the ABV, very boozy beer... Aftertaste: coffee and good attenuation with chocolate, grassy hops, wet bitterness.

Pours a deep dark brown color with a big grey head that leaves a thin film. Aroma is quite hoppy, herbal and fruity with earthy and roasty touches. Notes of lemongrass, green tea, pineapple, grapes, a bit of resin, peach, reeds and earth. Nice. Taste is mostly bitter with some residual sweetness and great expression of flavors. Coffee, lime, pineapple, melon, roasted bread and some licorice. Amazing really, intense and with well integrated alcohol. Big body, mid to high carbonation. Mildly boozy and with a rich finish. A fantastic Black IPA with bursts of flavor and plenty of body. Would love to try again.

Black color with a dense mocha head. Aroma is mostly hoppy with earthy, grassy notes. Also a bit of coffee and roasted malts. Taste is also hoppy, fresh and grassy but also has intense roasted notes. Starts malty and sweet but gets quite bitter on the finish and lingers in the aftertaste with coffee and hops. Quite heavy and smooth body. Really nice one, a style of beer I enjoy quite much.

12oz bottle via Winter Secret Santa 2015. Pours a murky black with some creamy, beige head. Nose is toast, malt, bread crust, if theres coffee bean then its the burnt expresso type, mild smoke, dried pine. Flavor follows, burnt toast, some licorice, some malt, lots of char, dried pine again, some burnt coffee bean. Full bodied, lightly sticky finish. Fine beer, but not a black IPA. This is a porter, every step of the way.

dark brown, smooth brown head.
aroma is dominated by coffee and dry hops, also some hard roasted malts in there. pretty good aroma actually. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, hops. very high on bitterness, feels quite light, but flavor wise this beer should be an imperial black IPA if that even exists.. impressive feat to get to this level of bitterness, it seems that both the roasted malts, the coffee and the hops in particular add up to the beer being extremely bitter and dry. There is a balancing chocolate like note though. very extreme black ipa. This seems to be hopped super aggressively.
bottle at home from McHughsfull bodied, piney, spicey fruity aroma. lightly smokey, moderate carbonation, warming, rich, light coffee, orange and pine

Dark brown with rich beige head. Aroma of hops and roasted malt. Good roasted caramel followed by good bitterness, strong coffee and some chocolate notes. Strong bitter aftertaste also rich with coffee notes.
Draught at Mikkeller Tokyo. Was somewhat expecting coffee but getting mostly dark roasted malt and piney hops, not bad as a strong b-ipa, but just a bit misleading on the title.

Bottle (from Koht). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is roast, malt, coffee, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, citrus, lemon, coffee, dark and milk chocolate. Finish is coffee bitter with lingering sweetness and some citric notes. Alcohol is mostly covered. Overall: very nice.
Bottle. Pours brown with medium thick tan head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, roasted, bready notes. Taste: espresso, chocolate, roasted, burnt bread, caramel. ABV well hidden.
Bottle. Pours black with taned head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. In taste medium sweet, lot of chocolate notes. Finish is dry, medium bitter and roasty.

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a creamy tanhead. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, hint of citrus, chocolate and a bit grassy. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, smooth texture, average carbonation. Finish is sweet, grassy bitterness, dry and roasted malt.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Max place. Thanks Shmupis. Very dark brown with a foamy head. Coffee, cold brew, pine and perfume aroma, coffee, bitter, coffee nibs taste. Smooth and full body, coffee finish. Very good.

Butelka 0,33l Kolorciemnobrązowy bez przebłysków, piana znikoma ale zostawia ślady na szkle. Aromat kawy i słodów palonych. Smak wytrawny, czuc alkohol, mocno rozgrzewa pojawia się chmiel i to wszystko.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Shmupi. Black with a tan head. Aroma with lots of coffee, some piney hops, and an alcoholic note. Roasty flavor, bitter and mildly sweetish, with chocolate, lots of coffee, and a bitter hops finish with an alcoholic note. Medium to full-bodied, a bit alcoholic.

Pitch black, creamy pour and a very fine, tan-coloured head. Smells like freshly brewed coffee, dark cherries, sour milk, dark chocolate. The taste follows the same note, with (milk?) coffee up front, followed by dark chocolate, roasted malts, a bit of cocoa and some resinous hops in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a nice carbonation level that gives this beer a very fresh feeling. A well made black IPA.

Bottle
Aroma-coffee, dark fruits
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-very bitter, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall- very good
black liquid with tan head. aroma of tropical fruits, caramel. taste of sweet coffee, parched raisin. full body, creamy, soft carbonisation

Tap (Alus Celle, Riga)
Eww, thats a sour aroma. Dark and sour is a combination I detest. It is dark, almost black, tight keggy tan head. For the strength, a very moderate palate, full and with keggy carbonation. Taste is interesting, a mix of a deep roast, even some dry burntness, a sweaty salty sourness, liquorice, and finally, as you swallow, some pure spirit. Vodka, but a good vodka, not a shitty one. Sourness appears as something more crotchy in the taste, which in a perverted (orval-loving) way isnt so offensive, in fact its interesting - I would just like to know whose crotch Im tasting. Finish biting, both from burntess and carbonic acid, but more happily from some nice dry bittering hops. Almost saves itself from the nasty sour start, I did enjoy it towards the end.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Molto scura, schiuma cremosa ed abbondante, marroncina.
Profumo floreale, agrumato, leggero resinoso ed erbaceo, sentori tostati, caffè.
Corposa, pastosa, corpo setoso (avena?), note dolci di malto, poi un grande amaro sui toni agrumati, sapori tostati e leggero sapore di caffè.
Alcool ben nascosto. Ottima.

Bottle @ home. Very dark brown to black color, medium to full sized a little creamy light brown head. Aroma is malts, hops and some chocolate notes. Taste malts, hops, nice mix of moderate malt roast and hoppyness, resulting in a decent bitter finish. Medium body, a bit silky texture, average to medium carbonation. Pretty enjoyable.

Bottle, bought @Kvickly, Middelfart. Pours deep opaque black with a large, staying creamy beige head. Aroma has sweet malts, light astringent, good roasted coffee. Citrus hops. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty fatness, chocolate, plenty of coffee, softly vinious, some sweetness. Good lingering bitterness from both coffee and hops. Lovely.

Delft 23-11-2015 (drankgigant.nl)

Mikkeller Black IPA maar heeft ook heel veel weg van een stout. Cola gekleurd met een caramel gekleurde schuimkraag (normale grootte). Smaakt overduidelijk naar flink gedroogd mout en heeft daardoor koffiesmaak. De smaak blijft helaas te kort hangen en is weinig bitter. Drinkt omdat het een IPA is makkelijk weg en is ook best lekker maar hij mist helaas wat smaak. Nu vrij standaard.

schenkt bruin in met minimale waardeloze witte kraag. aroma van chocolade, koffie, geroosterde mouten. smaken zijn zwak zoet, matig bitter, redelijk geroosterd karakter en koffie maar jongens ... jongens... wat is dit een dun spul zeg, ongelooflijk dun en waterig spul dit... ik ben afgehaakt om verder raten van dit dunne spul

Aroma:

Mostly hops, roasted malts, coffee, licorice.

Appearance:

Clear dark brown/black beer with a medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Where hops dominate in the aroma, the roasted malts do here in the beginning. Slightly bitter at the end and hops after the finish.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Mikkeller Sort Kaffe ].Clear dark black brown color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, roasted, coffee, light chcolate, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grass. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, grapefruit, roasted, coffee. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20150921]

Black IPA assez douce et équilibrée. Pas une caractérielle donc ... Un peu aqueuse. Gaz pas trop agressif. Gagne en fruité ( en intérêt aussi ... ! ) en se réchauffant. Le côté floral apparaît alors plus ...
Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 23/10/2015 BBD: 31/03/2017 Color negro, sabor herval, maltoso, dulce, no se aprecia los 9.2%, final seco.
KRS 220515. Black colour with a beige head. Flavour is coffee, roasted malt, grapefruit, pine, chocolate, caramel, alcohol. Full body. Nice beer.
Tap at Fairbar. Black body. Sweet aroma with some roasted malt. Sweet taste with medium bitterness. Hoppy flavours. Medium body with soft carbonation. Good black IPA.

Another very decent Black IPA, yet again I can say that it felt more like stout with strong hoppy character. Quite nice coffee kick, moderate roasted malts, some floral citrusy hops. Feels bit oily
Well balanced, nice brew

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 Floral and mild citrusy aroma. Coffee there. 
Black colour, hazy liquid and a small white head. 
Taste is a medium sweetness taken over by a medium bitterness in the aftertaste. 
Body is medium to full, texture is slick, average carbonation and a long finish. 
A good one. Try it.

Aroma: strong floral hops. 
Flavour: a dry floral bitterness with a coffee finish and a warm alcoholic mouthfeel. 
Colour: very dark reddish brown with a beige head.
Draught. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter roasted hoppy flavor. long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2015 Bottle. Dark with thick tan head, fair lacing. Aroma: First impression of citruses, lemon, tangerine, light orange, followed with roasted malts, milk chocolate and coffee. Taste is medium bitter, bittering hops excellently supported by coffee bittery, light sweet, coffee mouthfeel. Medium body, creamy to oily texture, long bitter finish. Possibly the best Black IPA Ive ever had, need more!

Shared from bottle.Very dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of coffee, citrus hops. Taste starts with coffee, roasted malt followed by nice citrus hoppy kick. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Nice citrus hoppy bitterness on coffee finish. Very good.

Poured out of the bottle black and syrupy, 40ºSRM

Nose has a beautiful floral aroma, sniffed the cap on this and got a nice mental image of when I sat in the lavender fields in summer in Hokkaido with bees lazily buzzing about the business of making lavender honey. The arome coming off a properly poured cup has citrus, pine and a tangerine-like fruitiness to it.

Mouthfeel is light with pronounced carbonation balancing a ponderously darkly roasted malt body. The palate is briefly allowed to appreciate this properly and judiciously malted ale before it is whisked away to decipher all kinds of herbaceous, pine-like, resinously bitter hop flavors.

The finish is hyssop bittter, prolonged and pronounced. Again, one of those hoppy finishes that reminds me of survival camp when I had to chaw on a mouthful of fir needles. Yes, we were told they were full of vitamin C, but it didnt change the fact that they were inhospitably bitter.

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle. Pours almost pitch black with a mostly lasting coffee brown head leaving plenty of lacing around the glass. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, biscuits, grassy hints, roasted notes. Taste is of coffee, dark chocolate, biscuity, some liquorice, bitter hoppy flavours on the finish. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Lovely.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Plus, Culemborg.
Pours dark brown with a big beige head. Coffee, roasted malts and pine hops in the aroma. Taste is medium bitter, finish is at first bitter but at the end a bit sweeter. Really well balanced and tasty black IPA

Tijdens bierproeverij, uitgeschonken in Struise BD degusteer glaasje. Veel
Mikkeller bieren deze avond! Deze is diep donkerbruin met een kleine
beige schuimkraag. Aroma van gebrande mout, espresso koffie, gebrande karamel, mokka, pijnboom en zwarte bessen. Krachtig smaakpallet, met de bittere en koffie achtige tonen die er het meeste uitspringen. Ook weer een Mikkeller die nogmaals moet worden geproefd. Dat is dus het nadeel van zo'n bierproeverij, de impressie is kort en het bier zit in een klein glas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pour black with a small white head. light roasty aroma with coffe hints. medium bitter, light sweet. average carbonation. soft bitter aftertaste

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21B: block IPA). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 10/06/17). AROMA: nice hop aroma with tropical fruit character, some floral and pine/resin. sweet malty background with a slight rosted note. APPEARANCE: dark Brown body with ruby color against light. clear. average beige head with good retention. TASTE: hop flavor with floral and pine notes, followed by a slight sweet malt background with mild coffee notes. medium-high bitterness that lingers beyond a dry and bitter finish. PALATE: medium-light body with a very slight velvety texture. moderate carbonation. no astringency. OVERALL: a very good black IPA, balanced towards hops altought it is made with coffee (2%).

330ml bottle from dranken geers. dark brown pour with quite a dark brown head. pretty frothy and carbonated. aroma is dry roasted coffee, caramel, nuts, malts and straw. coffee in the taste followed by dry malts. dry bitter finish.
Zwart vikgens mij met een mooie beige bruine kraag. Ruikt fruitig, geroosterd, koffie. Smaakt drop, geroosterd, hop, laurier, koffie.

bottle bought at our local bottle shop. poured a dark black colour with a large tanned head. nose is loaded with coffee, dark roasted malts, caramel, oily pines and fresh citrus. nice bitter aftertaste with a notice of grapefruits. nicely.

Piekna, bujna piana, pozostawiajaca firanki na szkle. W aromacie postawiono na dodatek kawy i czekoladowa slodowosc, choc subtelne akcenty chmielowe sa jak najbardziej obecne. Po ogrzaniu pojawia sie lekki rozpuszczalnik. W smaku chmiel jest znacznie bardziej intensywny, przelamuje ladnie gleboka palonosc. Aftertaste bardziej chmielowy niz palony. Alkohol nieodczuwalny. Dobre piwo, choc wydaje sie nieco niezdecydowane w ktora strone chce pójsc , a dodatek kawy nie jest jakos super odczuwalny.

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours dark black with reddish hue with big lasting foam head. Aroma is floral hop, bubblegum, coffee, dark fruit, raisin. Flavour is coffee, chocolate background with a floral bitter hit. Dark fruit hints. Really good BIPA

Bottle 330 ml at home. Appearance: Black body, with a huge beige head Head is thick and creamy. and has a great retention.
 Aroma: Fruity, (Citrus,pears) bubblegum, backbone of coffee and dark chocolate.. Taste: Moderate sweet and with a dark and fruity bitterness, fruits, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee grounds, citrus. Medium body, good carbonation, sticky palate.

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pour is very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma and flavor of ground coffee, pine resin, mild dark fruit, and roasted malt. Finish is bitter coffee and bitter hops with a bit of booze.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours hazy dark brown with beige head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla. Tastes a bit sweet with roasted bitterness.

3oz sample at Cerveza Mexico 2015. Opaque dark brown with a creamy to frothy brown head. Intense coffee and roasted aromas with hints of fruity hops, nuts. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet and heavily bitter, with a heavy roasted character and a heavy bitter roasted finish. Very heavy and complex. Very nice.

Poured jet black with big head. Aroma is of coffee, ans citrus hops. Quite a sweet aroma, very pleasant. Tastes of coffee, citrus fruits as well as dark berries. Nice bitter finish. Really fantastic beer

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with light brown, semi-densed head. Great lacing and good head retention. Medium roasted malts aroma - mainly coffee, but not so intense like in other coffee-based Mikkeller beers. In the background some dark fruits - plums, rasins. Taste is medium bitter (from coffee and hops), light coffee acidicy. In general solid, above average black IPA, well hiddena ABV. You find here some nice coffe, hoppy bitterness and good, drinkable beer.

Keg. Leeds International Beer Festival. Hazy, cola brown. Thin, clingy, tan head. High cocoa content chocolate. Fruity coffee bean. Bit of a pithy, chewy grapefruit thing. Taste is rich, vinous fruity bitter. Smooth, clean body. Finishes long, vinous fruity bitter. Decent, obviously.

Almost dark brown, nearly black color, a bit hazy. Nice head and lacing. Aroma: coffee, sour citrus fruits, resin, roasty tones. Taste: caramel coffee with citrus and resin finish, very nice aftertaste, which is a bit sour and roasty. Bitterenss is nice not lasting and not very high. Semi carbonated, semi sweet. Medium body and very drinkable. Really nice beer, Im not a fan of black IPAs but this one is really great.

Piwo radośnie wskakuje do pierwszej piątki black ipa, które piłem. Kawa i wytrawność, do tego ewidentnie IPA a nie stout, chmiele są ale nieprzesadne. Piwo to kawa, kawa, kawa. W ogóle nie czuć 9 procent. Alkohol b.dobrze przykryty. Do konkurencji z To-Ola trochę brakuje jednak
Bottle at home, bought at Hopduvel. Amazing beer, perfect blend of coffee, roast, chocolate notes, with the nice exotic bitterness of an IPA. Awesome.

(Mikkeller Sort Kaffe) From a trade with Beerhunter111, thanks! Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 9.2%
Black coloured body, huge beige head sitting on top, thick and creamy. Great retention.
Nice aroma, very fruity, pears, bubblegum, coffee on the back, chocolate.
Taste has coffee, fruits, faint chocolate, roasted malts, coffee grounds, citrus.
Medium body, good carbonation, sticky palate.
Nice.

.33l on bottle @ Hannikus Cave. Pours almost black with low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, hops, citrus fruits, coffee, milk chocolate. Flavor is hops, malts, coffee, earthy, citrus fruits and hops. Dry after taste.

330ml bottle [Many thanks to bartlebier!]. Black colour with huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige to tan head. Roasty, chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of coffee, bitter and herbal hoppy overtones produce the Black IPA-typical green onion spiciness. Taste is slightly sweet dark malty, notes of coffee and chocolate, some roast, liquorice, piney hoppy overtones. Another example of the high quality Mikkeller typically delivers across all style borders.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, expresso, licorice, fruity hops, citrus, pine. Flavor is hard roasted malts, rich black coffee, coffee grounds, expresso, heavy licorice, citrus, piney hops. Medium body, average carbonation, bitter and lasting bitter finish. 290715
Coffee, citrus, cocoa, coffee grounds. A strong dark beer that really fills your mouth.

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma is hoppy, citrussy, cocoa, coffee, ripe citrus, orange peel, light tobacoo. Taste is hoppy, citrussy, ripe orange, cocoa, chocolate, grounded coffee.

Das Bier ist fast schwarz und hat eine große stabile dunkel beige Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kaffee, im Hintergrund sehr hopfig bitter. Geschmack kräftig röstmalzig, Kaffee, im Abgang sehr hopfig bitter, dazu gesellt sich noch eine leicht schokoladige Note.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, and citrusy hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of coffee, roasted malt, and citrusy hops, leading to a bitter finish.

33cl bottle at home from Only Good Beer, Budapest. Body is nearly black, head is very big, rocky, brownish, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is roasty, flavor is dark chocolate, honey, mild coffee, brownies, hops, light sour cherry, more coffee. Light to medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, slightly sourish. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, dark chocolate, alcohol is totally hidden. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy excellent hoppy and roasty very tasty chocolate dessert beer.

Bottle @ 5 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Brown pour with a small head. Sort of farty on the nose. Yeasty apple. Pine wood. Very strong peppery hop bitter flavor. Char, general toasted grains. A touch of coffee and cocoa. Medium body, soft carb. Not as bad tasting as the nose suggests. OK.

Draught @Mikkeller bar, Viktoriagade. Pours black with a thin brown head. Nice roasted malty, cocoa and chocolate in aroma. Hoppy, citrusy flavor with pleasant roasted notes, ash, and cocoa. Not that much coffee as I thought. Good one still.

Bottle at Ølhus Stockholm. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, hops, citrus, vanilla, oak and nuts. Bitter finish with coffee, citrus, roasted malts, hops and nuts. Exquisite black IPA.
330ml bottle @ Örebro Ölcafe. Black with a creamy tan head. Sweet aroma, coffee, liquorice, burnt malt. thick oily mouthfeel. Taste is very sweet, chocolate, coffee, licorice. Bitter and dry finish.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a long lasting beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, hops, coffee, chocolate, caramel notes, dark fruits, citrus. Oily texture. Creamy mouthfeel. Light bitter finish. Nice.
Bottle at home. Deep amber beer with a beige head. Hoppy chocolate aroma. Hoppy, chocolate roasted flavour with some citrus and floral notes.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2015 Black color with some reddish notes and a good beige head. Aroma has lots of coffee, dark chocolate and some citrus and grapefruit hints with a piney backbone. Medium to full body, with a really smooth and silky texture. Taste follows the aroma, again, coffee beans and chocolate, with a medium hop presence with citrus and grapefruit. Bittersweet aftertaste. More Black than IPA, but really solid though.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of malt, coffee, some floral notes, citrus and roasted malt. Flavor is sweet and malty with some coffee, pine, some roasted notes, licorice and caramel. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Close to black, clear-looking and with a small, dense, dark beige head. Lots of coffee in the aroma, a pleasant hoppyness too, pine cones and resins and a nice grapefruit touch. Mocha and dark chocolate. Its full-bodied and lightly warming with a nice carbonation level. Mocha, dark chocolate, coffee, pine cones and resins in the flavor, with a fine bitterness. Lasting finish. Too much on the roasted side this one, but quite nice anyway. 150522

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, coffee, citrus and grape. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long chocolate, coffee, citrus and grape. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottled. Dark cola color, beige lacy head. Intense nose of cold coffee, ashy roasted malt, a whiff of chocolate, sweet fruity hops (papaya, cantaloupe) and a hint of ripe berries. Some caramel aromas as well. Malty, dryish, flavor with hoppy fruitiness, a hint of alcoholic warmth. Strong coffee aftertaste, some ashy and papery/yeasty notes and clean, medium bitterness. Slightly warning aftertaste. Medium to full body, velvety texture, low carbonation. Very good.

33cl bb04/2016, Geers V2015. Mistakingly poured and had this as an ImpStout and was disappointed by its lack of thick black coffee & cream goodness. Seeing it entered here as Black IPA makes much more sense, although still the postmodern sleekness of its composition at 9,2% still feels a tad thin and metallic. Upsides: gorgeous as ever fruity exotic hop pyrotechnics (maracuya and tangerine peel, lichee, candied lime, red grape), going off in the back palate and building engineered layers of bitterness on a slender cold filter coffee palate. Like my black malts turned up more in Black IPAs, but this one was very easy for its abv.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a beige head long lasting. Taste is very hoppy for an BIPA, Fruits, roast, coffe, bitter. Very crips, good BIPA, maby the best ive had :)
Pitch black brew. OK head. Nice mixture between grass, citrus and coffee. Better as expected.
Bottle at konttori, tampere. Black color, tanned head. Aroma is coffee, roasty, some hops. Nice roasty body, coffee, hops, fruits.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Pickets Lock campsite Ponders End Thursday 2nd April 2015   No surprise that there is lots of coffee, soft in mouth, with a streaky green fresh hops. A truly lovely beer, I must say Mikkeller are really on top form of late. Loving the coffee and hops combo, I never realised just how hoppy this was, it builds and builds, it is damn hoppy. A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov16 4.0

Bottle. Black with big light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, pine, grapefruit and hop. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, pine, hop, grapefruit, medium sweet, little liquorice and bitter.

Bottle at Örebro Ölcafé. Hoppy smell with chocolate and dark malts. I didnt sense any coffee in the smell. Hoppy with some cohocolate. Not overly bitter. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice mix of hops and malts. I thought it would taste like coffee though.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ hki. Black. Quite nice tangerene fruity, ashy roasty nose. Like a jar of tangerene lime marmelade in a smoldering pile of wood. Med full bodied, bitter, ashy dry finish. Surprisingly thin for the abv. But nice flavourful. Coffee beans in the finish. Clean, lots of flavours, but seems a bit confused, randomly thrown together. The orange/tangerene with the coffee isnt all bad though.-- bb

11-MAR-2015, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma is very fresh hops. Taste is very fresh hops as well and then roast - mostly coffee. Clearly dry-hopped. Not very bitter for the style. Soft carbonation, medium+ body. A bit simple but still a very nice drink.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting off-white head. Pitch black body. Roasted malt coffee caramel aroma and flavor with a fair amount hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish. Alcohol well hidden. A bit one dimentional.

330 ml bottle @ Konttori, Tampere. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, pine and mild yeastiness. Flavour of rich burnt roastiness, piney bitterness, citrus, coffee bitterness, some licorice and mild sweetness. Almost full bodied. Alcohol is dangerously well hidden. Great.

Bottle provided by Christian. Thanks. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Good hops, good coffee and good roast. Strawberries and red grapefruit. Smooth and really soft! Lovely and dangerously quaffable!
Black with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of herbal hops, nettles, citrus, with hints of licorice and coffee. Sweet, dark malty flavour, with citrus, licorice, mint and nettles. Mild bitter finish.

330ml bottle @ Brewdog Helsinki 

Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, espresso, licorice, grassy hops, pine and resin. Taste is roasty, hoppy and grassy with some coffee, espresso and mocha notes. Finish is roasty, hoppy and grassy with bitterness, coffee, mocha and espresso. A roasty black IPA with loads of coffee. Pretty good.

33 cl bottle @ BrewDog Helsinki, BBE 28.04.2016. Aroma has cold coffee and licorice. Also some licorice root. Flavour has strong hoppy notes, grapefruit, licorice and some cold coffee. Foamy palate. A bit messy and quite dry. Not bad but I expected more.

Bottle shared at the Kays tasting, CDA interlude, cheers to Kenwold 30/12/14.
Light black with a decent khaki covering.
Nose is pine, biscuit, light charr, faint coffee, pineapple, cocoa dust.
Taste comprises pine, roast, bitter tropical fruits, coffee notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Respectable CDA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Beer Hunters, Pori. Dark brown color, decent brownish head. Citrusy hoppyness, toasted maltyness and coffee in the nose. Medium-bodied. Quite coffeish flavor. Otherwise typical CDA flavors: citrus and toasted malts. Quite nice coffee dominated CDA.

33 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori. BBE 28.04.2016.
Pours dark brown color with a red tint and a large off-white head, a bit of a gusher really. Quite strong coffee on the aroma, some caramel and roasted malts, mild resin and lots of hops too, distant vanilla notes on the background. Coffee and roasted malts on the flavor too, somewhat fruity with orange, resinous hops and some grapefruits, lingering bitter chocolaty finish. Alcohol is quite well hidden. A red too strong carbonation ruins the show a bit, otherwise a very tasty coffee CDA. 
4525
Bottle @ Mogwai, Helsingborg 3/1-15. A lot of coffee/coffee beans with notes of hops. Body is medium, coffee in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a light brown head. Aroma is pretty fruity with both tropical fruits and coffee berries, espresso and even some green coffee beans. Taste has sweeter fruity notes and some hops, but also some bitter roasty notes, bitter hops and coffee, though the coffee is very light roasted.

duft: kaffe ristet malt C humle,
SMag:C humle. ristet malt. kaffe grøn kaffe. meget kaffe eftersmag. men meget humle smag. appelsin citrus smag også
Tuoksu makea, kahvinen, omenaa, voikukkaa, ruista. Vaahto kestävä, röpelö, mokka. Maku kofeiininen kirpeä, kahvinen, ruis, palanut. Suutuntuma pehmyt, hapan. Kokonaisuus hyvä, muttei hätkähdyttävä.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Black with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, coffee and moderate hoppy - pine. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 110215

Bottle. Dark brown with a fluffy tan head. Citrus, cocoa powder, some green herbs and fruity notes in aroma. Bitter chocolate, more roasted notes and coffee mixed with some charcoal in taste. More of citrus notes steps up later on. Feels like a fairly hoppy brew with some citrusy licorice notes appearing towards the end.

1/I/15 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ holiday - BB: 28/IV/16 (2015-3) 
Clear black to brown beer, big creamy beige head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: some exotic fruits, pineapple, grapefruit, citrus, hint of mocha and coffee. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: hoppy start, fruity bitterness, lots of citrus, bit piny, resinous, bit of caramel. Aftertaste: bitter hops, mocha, some exotic fruits, resinous bitterness, citrus, little sourish.

330 ml. bottle @ home. Obtained from Dranken Geers. BBF 28/04/2016 (not very informative in my opinion). Very dark wood brown, reasonably big beige head. Great lacing. Nose is coffee with reasonable roast, ice coffee & light liquorish sweetness. Taste is bitter bark & roots in a good way, roasted sharp coffee, ice coffee, pine, blackberry bitter hops, light liquorish, fruity grapefruit hops in the finish. Bitter roast in the finish that works well. Slick bodied. No sign of ABV. This is pretty solid stuff. I am liking it quite a bit.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Impressive stuff. Absolutely loaded with coffee and has that dry cocoa powder type feel throughout which is nice. Very bitter on the finish and slightly aggressive. I like it

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Semi opaque brown beer, small pale tan head. Airy softish palate, semi dry, mild fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, little cream. Mild piney hops, trace of marmalade. Light semi dry finish. Not getting much coffee. Its decent but was expecting a lot more from a 9.2% CDA.

(On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Dec 29 2014) Pours very dark brown with a tight lingering tan nitro type head, bubbles up the glass side, a bit of lace. Aroma of fresh brewed coffee, dark malts, bit of semisweet chocolate, earthy fresh pine hops, touch of ripe citrus when warm. On the palate, again fresh brewed coffee to the fore, lightly sweet dark malt and chocolate behind, and more of that lovely earthy pine forest hop character building into the finish along with a discrete but moderate roast coffee character. Again, some citrus hop character showed up in the finish when warm as well. Not at all ashy. Medium bodied but creamy, again seemed like nitro, no alcohol heat at all for me. The emphasis here seemed to be on the side of coffee rather than IPA, but hop character was a good match for the style if not super forward. Drinks really nicely if not as complex and balls out as, for example, To Øls Black Malts and Body Salts.
Bottle @ Mogwai, Helsingborg 150103. Roasted malty and light hoppy with loads of coffee and coffee beans , sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted with coffee.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium to big moussy light tan head. Aroma of citrus, lemon peel, coffee, licorice, light ash and mango. Taste is very light sweet and medium bitter with notes of coffee, citrus and pine. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice. Great coffee notes.
Deep dark brown colour, medium sized, creamy beige head; aroma of roasted coffee, pine, citruses and some tropical fruity notes; taste is mixture of a citrusy IPA and a coffee; really good

Bottled. Pours deep amber with an average, lacing beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, citrus and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Black IPA.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar, Copenhagen - black pour with tan head. Roasted malty aroma and taste, some tropical hoppy tones throughout, some chocolate, coffee, pine needles on the palate, dry bitter finish. Very good.

Bottle thanks to Kenny? It pours deep brown with a decent light tan head. The nose is fresh, bitter-sweet, earthy roast, varnish, sherbet, fresh citrus peel, star fruit and sherbet. The taste is bitter, earthy roast, coffee, cocoa, sherbet, earthy, pine needles, varnish, lemon rind and grapefruit with a dry, citrussy finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Hides abv pretty well. Rather tasty and drinkable.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Kenny. Pours rich brown with a creamy beige head. Fairly muted aroma, some dry grainy toast, chalky cocoa, earth. Medium sweet flavor with oily coffee, roast, subtle ripe citrus, charred wood. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Rich roast on the finish, oily, some baking cocoa, orange rind. Not bad.

27.12.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is mild and fresh roasted, espresso, hops, leafs, lawn, pine needles, dark malts, burnt caramel, licorice, pine needles. Taste is dry roasted, pine needles, espresso, leafs, burnt caramel, minerals, bark, hops, dark sugar, dark malts, grass, licorice. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

Botella de 33 cl de cervezalandia en el momento el 25-12-2014. con fecha de cons pref para 28-04-2016. color negro intenso con espuma beige. Aromas y sabores intensos de cafés torrefactos con buenos toques frescos herbáceos que dejan un amargo persistente. Intensos sabores y un cuerpo medio de 9.2 vol fácil de beber. Bastante buena, recuerdos a la sort gult pero con una buena dosis de café. Para repetir sin duda

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Deep amber/brown beer with a rich lasting beige head. Hoppy chocolate aroma, cocoa, citrus, grass, soot, leather, milk chocolate notes, pine and peach notes. Hoppy roasted flavor, chocolate, soot, pine, citrus, floral notes, some licorice. Fresh rather Porter-like BIPA.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with nice creamy nut brown head. Aroma is grassy, coffee berries, green coffee, dark bitter chocolate, roasty malts. Taste is dark fruity berries and sweet dark malts. Chocolate milk and cocoa. Grassy hops. Light body for the abv, which is well hidden, roasty dry finish. Reminds me of citric espresso.

The aroma is full of hops, herbs and flowers. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of hops and flowers. It feels very fresh and light considering the pitch black color but there is also some bitterness as well which I dont mind at all. A surprisingly fresh beer. Excellent!
Ottima black ipa, con intense note di cioccolato e soprattutto caffe che accompagna i sorso dallinizio alla fine, arricchendosi con gli strascichi fruttati del luppolo. Ottima in qualsiasi orario.

Bottle. 

Pours very dark Brown to Black. Nice, prickly foam with a light Brown color. 

Aroma is very fresh coffee, fresh fruits. Smells like a much lighter IPA.

Taste is green coffee fruits, light roast, acid, mildly capsuled with the roasted malts and caramel. Could have had a bit more body, but thats just me. 
Very nice overall

Bottle. Almost pitch black with small tan head. Aroma has hops, rich green coffee beans, chocolate, herbs, some tropical fruits and some roasty stuff as well as thick coffee roast. Taste is hoppy, bitter, raw and full of coffee. The high abv is nowhere to be found. Well balanced.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a creamy dark beige head. The aroma is coffee, fruity hops, roasted malts and light chocolate. The flavor is light pine, citrus, coffee, licorice and roast. Alcohol is very well hidden. Tasty.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a little sediment and a light tan that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are coffee, grapefruit, herbs, and pine - with a bitter finish.

Bottle from Mogwai Bar & Mat. Aroma is bitter hops with a bit of herbs. Pours black with a small beige head. Taste is hoppy with a roasty feeling, some espresso taste. Palate is a bit creamy. Overall a pretty nice beer, exciting ipa.

On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm. 

Black with a tan head. A lot of coffee in this one. Also hops, tropical fruit, light herbs and some roasted malt. Well hidden alcohol and with a bitter finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a big beige head, aroma has the expected roast and pine, taste has big chocolate action with some roasted malt, subtle pine, coffee, a very pleasant CDA.

33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2014, with coffee, from Mikkeller Webshop, very complex bitter brew, roasted/fruity/woody and slightly spicy/sweet, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Bottle. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty piney hoppy coffee aroma. Roasted malty bitter hoppy coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee bitter hoppy finish.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette - Thanks. Pitch black - offwhite head. High coffee, nice hoppy, ok bitterness, resin, fruity hoppy, light tropical hoppy notes, licorice, some burned malts, lovely coffee taste.....
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a huge tan head. Aroma is solid coffee and hops fruity. Black ipaish with a load of coffee. Coffee herbdl, fruity and roasted finish, bitter.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of hops and flowers.
Roasted and hoppy flavor of flowers and grass.
Hoppy finish.
